instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_WLAN: What is PP3V3_WLAN? PP3V3_WLAN is a 3.3v power rail that powers the wifi circuit or wifi card. This can go missing when the inductor acting as a fuse before PP3V3_WLAN blows..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No WLan hardware installed.
threads.message:
Laptop had a cup of coffee dumped on it by a feline villain.

Managed to get it back up and running, but it is reporting no WiFi hardware. Have tested with a known good card & cable.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_WLAN</SIGNAL>:Probe 1508 = 3.317 

L3501::All Pins = 1.5mV

<CAPACITOR>C3522</CAPACITOR> == 3.317

L3504::Pin1 & 2 == 3.317

<CAPACITOR>C3521</CAPACITOR> == 3.317

<CAPACITOR>C3520</CAPACITOR> == 3.3137

<TRANSISTOR>Q3550</TRANSISTOR>::Pin 1 == 3.315
<TRANSISTOR>Q3550</TRANSISTOR>::Pin 2 == 3.315
<TRANSISTOR>Q3550</TRANSISTOR>::Pin 3 == 1.8mV
<TRANSISTOR>Q3550</TRANSISTOR>::Pin 4 == 3.315

<CAPACITOR>C3550</CAPACITOR> == 3.315
<CAPACITOR>C3551</CAPACITOR> == 3.315
<RESISTOR>R3550</RESISTOR> == 1.8mV & 32kOhms
<RESISTOR>R3551</RESISTOR>::Pin 1 == 3.315 & Pin 2 = 1.8mV   & 10k Ohms.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7921</TRANSISTOR>::Pin 1 == 3.315

The coffee wasn't around this area though, it was more around the bios area. Maybe that gives a clue.

Thanks in advance for the suggestions! :)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No WLan hardware installed.
threads.message: Pin 4 and 7 of <CHIP>U3540</CHIP>? Check connector closely for damage.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No WLan hardware installed.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3540</CHIP>::Pin4 == 3.3v
<CHIP>U3540</CHIP>::Pin7 == 2.4mV

Everything looks nice and tidy in the general area. The connector looks good as well. I just tested with another cable again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No WLan hardware installed.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No WLan hardware installed.
threads.message: <CHIP>U3540</CHIP> has a pull-up resistor on pin 7 to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_WLAN_F</SIGNAL> (<RESISTOR>R3553</RESISTOR>)....  Check if it is present, also doble check connector or maybe <CHIP>U3540</CHIP> is shorted and pulling down the voltage......

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No WLan hardware installed.
threads.message: How can I check if <CHIP>U3540</CHIP> is pulling down?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No WLan hardware installed.
threads.message: Measure in diode mode, red probe to ground and black on pin 7, report value....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No WLan hardware installed.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No WLan hardware installed.
threads.message:
It should be low with airport connected and high with disconnected.

Check on diode mode:
L3501 pin 1,4
<CAPACITOR>C3530</CAPACITOR>/31 both sides
<RESISTOR>R3510</RESISTOR>/11 both sides

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No WLan hardware installed.
threads.message:
L3501::1 = 0.324
L3501::2 = 0.319

<CAPACITOR>C3530</CAPACITOR> & <CAPACITOR>C3531</CAPACITOR> are missing off the board.
Checked on a donor 3115-B and it has those two capacitors. Going to do a transplant and report back.

I must have knocked them off the board because they were measured above....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No WLan hardware installed.
threads.message:
So I replaced <CAPACITOR>C3530</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C3531</CAPACITOR> and the wifi works, I must have knocked them off at some stage.

Thanks Dukefawks.


Close and mark solved please.
I can't work out how to close a thread.
